speaker.name: Shengming Shan
speaker.role:
CEO / SWR Technology
Founder / I FLY YOUNG CCE

speaker.name: Irene Yuan
speaker.role:
CEO / RELinkage
Founder / Voltraware, EVP and board director of Jiabiqi Co., Ltd.

speaker.name: Ta-Chang Fu
speaker.role: The Dedicated Hard Drive R&D Department Mechanical Manager / Western Digital

text: Tune in to wisdom from CCE Mentors

recordings.title: How to face and deal with failure/setback at work
recordings.question: Q1.How should I see failure/setbacks at work? Q2. What do I gain from failure/frustration at work?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE 2024-2025 Focus Group Interview 1
recordings.question: Q1. What is CCE Focus Goup? How can it help me?

recordings.title: Which job is more stable?
recordings.question: Q1. I am in my 40s and want to change jobs. I want to find a company that is suitable for me and is relatively stable. What should I do?

recordings.title: Why is my work performance not improving?
recordings.question: Q1. My work performance has never improved. How can I judge whether it is my own fault or whether it is a trial given to me by God, allowing me to learn lessons through this waiting process?

recordings.title: I work hard but haven't been able to find a suitable job
recordings.question: Q1. Do I need to change the job/position I am looking for? Q2. What else can I do?

recordings.title: How to prepare for a job interview?
recordings.question: Q1. What preparations should I do before the interview? Are there any special reminders for people at different career stages (newcomers in the workplace, changing employers in the same industry, or changing careers)? Q2. What are the mistakes to avoid and tips to master during interviews?

recordings.title: What should I do about the struggles of career development, starting a family, and caring for my parents?
recordings.question: My parents are now older and really want me to move back to my hometown. Firstly, to be closer to them and be able to take care of them (although they are currently healthy and can take care of themselves). Secondly, they still hope that I can get married (but this is not the life I want).

recordings.title: What should I do if I see injustice at workplace?
recordings.question: Q1. My boss has lowered my salary for a long time and I feel aggrieved. What should I do? Q2. I have seen and experienced political struggle and persecution from superiors, rank-and-file, and subordinates in the company. In addition to praying, should I face it directly, point it out, and persist? What should I do?

recordings.title: Meeting patron(s) for your career
recordings.question: Q1. Is there a so-called patron in the workplace? How do I tell if someone is helping me or taking advantage of me? Q2. Is it reasonable to sign a part-time contract for a part-time job recommended by a friend? Is this too much?

recordings.title: Growing Your Network
recordings.question: Q1. Do I need to expand my network? Why? How to do it? Q2. A lot of unknown people asked to connect with me on my LinkedIn, what should I do with them?

recordings.title: How do you know if you are on the right track?
recordings.question: As you enter your sixth year of work, do you still feel like you are dependent on others? Example Q&A

recordings.title: I haven't found a starting point that will allow me to move towards my ideal job. Should I give up?
recordings.question: Q1. Shall I pursue a film or show director's job? Q2.  Does qualities of my coworker matter? Q3. Shall I keep looking for opportunities to pursue my dream job? Or shall I pick a job that covers my cost of living & paying off debt?

recordings.title: Two bosses have different opinions, what should I do?
recordings.question: Q1.I have two bosses (authorities) and their opinions conflict. Who should I listen to? Q2. Whose needs should I meet? What can I do?

recordings.title: Key elements for effective job hunting
recordings.question: Q1. How to identify a job opportunity which is truly good fit for me? Q2. How to equip myself for new job opportunities? Q3.What specific qualities are evaluated by hiring managers? Q4.How do I handle disappointment?

recordings.title: How to face the boss...
recordings.question: Q1. Should I talk to my boss about a salary increase? how to talk about it? Q2. How to face the impossible task assigned by the boss?

recordings.title: Seeking first to understand then be understood
recordings.question: How to deal with the discrepancies between boss's evaluation and self evaluation? How to respond manager's feedback?

recordings.title: Retirement Financial Planning
recordings.question: Q1: How should I plan and prepare for my financial needs after retirement from work? Q2: My career plan is to continue my current stable job and retire within 5-10 years. But my family feels that our pension planning and savings are not enough, and they want me to accept newer challenges. Do I need to change to a job with better pay?

recordings.title: How to respond to the boss's emotions
recordings.question: The leader at work is emotionally unstable and often handles problems by swearing and getting angry (without directly telling her what she thinks). Although sometimes I know what she thinks, in this state, I don't want to I can satisfy her requests in this way at any time, because it consumes a lot of my strength to deal with her emotions every time. What should I do? Can I pursue other job opportunities?

recordings.title: How to lead a team
recordings.question: Q1: I have no management responsibilities, should I be concerned about this issue? Q2: As a (junior, middle, senior) manager of a company/unit, how should I lead my team? Q3: As the person in charge of the company, how should I lead the team?

recordings.title: Achieving set goals
recordings.question: Q1: I often fail to achieve the goals set by my boss or myself. Why? What should I do?

recordings.title: Which path should I continue to develop? A new major? Or the original major?
recordings.question: Q1: My undergraduate and first master's degrees were in design, and I worked for a while after graduation. Later, my family felt that the IT major was developing well and had many job opportunities, so they suggested that I study for a second master's degree in computer science. Although I graduated successfully, I don't like programming very much. When I was applying for a job, I found that employment was not as good as I imagined. Now I am very confused and hesitate to go all out to find a design-related position?

recordings.title: How to handle conflicts with colleagues
recordings.question: Q1: My colleague is very articulate, likes to steal the limelight, and even likes to take credit for everything I do. My boss can’t do anything to him and asks me to be patient. What should I do? Q2: I will compromise in the moment because I am afraid that my colleagues will be angry, but I will feel useless afterwards. What should I do? Q3: I will make a habit of choosing a plan that is more acceptable to my colleagues to avoid conflicts. Is this right? What should I do?

recordings.title: How to prepare for and make career adjustments
recordings.question: Q1: I currently work as an accountant, but I am more talented and interested in beauty and cosmetics. How should I prepare myself and make career adjustments? Q2: I am currently working as a frontline staff member and am only responsible for my own professional projects, but I am interested in taking up a management position. How should I prepare myself and make career adjustments?

recordings.title: As the head of a department, what should I do?
recordings.question: Q1: I am the head of the company's human resources department. One of the company's indicators was not achieved and was attributed to the human resources department. I analyzed the reasons and proposed a solution. To solve the problem, we must reform. The company asked me to produce a data analysis report. I made a complete analysis report, but it was never approved and the problem was never solved. Since I can't solve these problems, the company's senior management has been putting pressure on me. What should I do?

recordings.title: How to build a relationship with my boss?
recordings.question: Q1: I have recently been transferred from an engineer to a project leader, and I am still learning the new role. The new boss has a marketing background, and I cannot feel comfortable communicating with her. How can I build a relationship with my boss?

recordings.title: What should I do if I am wronged at work?
recordings.question: Q1: My colleague's one-sided statement made my boss think it was my fault, what should I do?

recordings.title: Interaction with colleagues at work
recordings.question: Q1: How to help my colleague who holds a negative view on others' intent?

recordings.title: Seeking Guidance II
recordings.question: Q1: If I have received God's promise, but they have not been fulfilled, how should we continue to pray or respond? Q2: How Christians can preach the gospel in the workplace?

recordings.title: Seeking Guidance I
recordings.question: Q1: How to seek God’s will in the workplace ? Q2: How can I confirm that what I am doing is from God’s will?

recordings.title: Submit to a boss who is not easy to obey
recordings.question:
The Bible teaches that you must obey your boss, both gentle and perverse.
Q1: What are the reasons that prevent you from obeying your boss? Q2: How to overcome these obstacles? Q3: If my boss often asks me to do things that are within the scope of his responsibilities, I feel a little unfair and I also feel that my boss has not shouldered the responsibilities he should bear. How to respond? Do you want to obey blindly?

recordings.title: Managing disobedient subordinates
recordings.question: Q1: How to manage subordinates who are disobedient and do not follow instructions? Q2: I have reported to my supervisor that I would like to remove the disobedient subordinate from his current position. Is this correct?

recordings.title: Dealing with negative emotions in the workplace
recordings.question: Q1: Where do negative emotions (anxiety, fear, worry, fear, tension, stress...) come from in the workplace? Q2: How to deal with negative emotions in the workplace?

recordings.title: Career Advancement
recordings.question: Q1: What is the purpose and meaning of career advancement? Q2: Many people hope to be promoted, which can bring about salary increases, realization of self-worth, and breakthroughs in abilities. But is it too egotistical and selfish to want to be promoted for your own benefit?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview V
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group?  Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: Prepare yourself for future opportunities in the workplace
recordings.question: Q1. How to expand the breadth of your exposure within the current scope of responsibilities? Q2. How to prepare yourself so that you can accept the promotion of your responsibilities and roles and take on more and greater responsibilities in the future?

recordings.title: Questions to ask about work
recordings.question: Q1: Why work? What is the purpose of work? What is the meaning of work? What is the value of work?

recordings.title: Die to oneself in the workplace
recordings.question: How to die to oneself in the workplace?

recordings.title: 20240705 Innerlife Conference Marketplace Workshop Q&A
recordings.question: How to find rest in the busy work?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview IV
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group?  Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: How to deal with a critical boss? How to become a manager who develops subordinates?
recordings.question: 1.(As an employee) How do you deal with a boss who tends to criticize and judge others? My boss is quite sensitive. Sometimes he will jump to conclusions based on a certain fragment of an event and he is very confident in his judgment. Sometimes I feel wronged or feel judged. How should I deal with it when faced with judgment? 2. (As an employee) In the sharing session on 5/27, I mentioned the trust relationship with the boss. Whether the boss can make others trust him and be willing to communicate requires certain qualities, but my boss is completely opposite to these qualities. The boss feels insecure and distrustful. Sometimes I really don’t want to talk to him much, and he won’t change in a short period of time. How do I respond when I feel disrespected, not listened to, criticized, and the boss is the only one speaking? 3. (As a supervisor) At the 5/27 gathering, it was mentioned that as a supervisor, one often faces a problem, which is dissatisfaction with the work of subordinates. When you are dissatisfied with the work of your subordinates, what are some ways to deal with it that are more likely to help them?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview III
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group?  Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: My mission and my goals
recordings.question: Q1: I prayed and asked God, what is my mission, but I have never quite understood it, so that I do not have a clear goal. What should I do? Q2: What is my mission? How did I know/discover my mission? Q3: What are my goals? How do I set my goals?

recordings.title: Colleagues who sow discord
recordings.question: Q1: What should you do if you encounter a colleague who likes to gossip ? It has caused discord between the team?

recordings.title: My employees don't initiate conversations with me, why?
recordings.question: Q1: What kind of people do I like to talk to? Q2: What kind of boss do I like to talk to? Q3: My employees don't initiate conversations with me, why?

recordings.title: What if my boss at work is also my authority at church...
recordings.question: Q1: What are the (expected) benefits? Q2: What are the (expected) challenges? Q3: How should I respond if my boss at work invites me to attend his church?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview II
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group? Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview I
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group? Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: Looking for jobs II
recordings.question: Q1: The mentality you should have when looking for a job. Q2: What you should work on to land a job

recordings.title: Challenging Work Environment
recordings.question: Q1. The company requires intensive overtime work from time to time, how should I deal with it? Q2. Due to workplace bullying, I was forced to resign. How can I prepare myself for my next job and avoid encountering the same work environment?

recordings.title: Looking for jobs I
recordings.question: Q1: I have been out of work for more than 1 year. How can I find the next job? Q2: I was recently laid off. How should I prepare myself to land the next job?

recordings.title: Performance at Work
recordings.question: Q1: What to do if my performance at work is not as expected? Q2: Should Christians have better performance at work?

recordings.title: Am I suitable to be a supervisor? What kind of supervisor?
recordings.question: Q1. What's the difference between a Technical Leader and a Team/People manager? Q2. Am I suitable to be a supervisor? What kind of supervisor?

recordings.title: Work overtime and Obedience
recordings.question: Q1: My boss keeps asking me to work overtime (which is not part of my job). Do I need to obey him all the time? Q2: How to communicate wisely with my boss?

recordings.title: How to deal with small groups in the company?
recordings.question: Q1: Why are there small groups in the company? Q2: Shall I participate at these small group(s)?

recordings.title: Management: Leading loners or subject matter expert(s)
recordings.question: Q1: How to lead a team (or person) who has no less, or even more subject matter expertise than me? Q2: How to lead/help a loner, or a person who has strong opinions?

recordings.title: Dealing with colleague(s) having animosity against me
recordings.question: Q1: I can feel one colleague's clear animosity against me, and I constantly run into challenges communicating with him. What are the possible reasons? Q2: How should I adjust myself, or what actions could I take, so I can get the task going?

recordings.title: An assignment that is beyond my expertise
recordings.question: Q1. My boss give me an assignment that is not beyond my expertise. It really stressed me out. What is my boss thinking? Q2. Shall I accept such assignment? What should I consider? How should I respond?
recordings.audioUrl: /audio/CCE20240226_上司交辦我不熟悉領域的項目.mp3

recordings.title: Working with (overconfident, talkative) people
recordings.question: Q1: How to work with or react to someone that is overly confident? Q2: How to conduct effective communication with talkative people (who tends to share excessive amount of information or dominate the conversation)?
recordings.audioUrl: /audio/CCE20240219_與過度自信喜歡長篇大論的人共事.mp3

recordings.title: Should I care about everything that my boss cares about?
recordings.question: Q1. Should I be close to the coworker who has tension with my boss? Q2. Should I care about everything that my boss cares abour? Or what should I care about?

recordings.title: How to be with my boss
recordings.question: Q1: Can I treat my boss as my friend? Q2: What's the boundary when dealing with my boss?

recordings.title: Favor at Workplace
recordings.question: Q1: What is favor? What favor have I received at workplace?  Q2: Shall I seek favor? How to seek favor at workplace?

recordings.title: Managing employee's expectations on task assignments
recordings.question: Q1: One of my team members are selective about his task assignment. He likes certain task assignments that are beneficial to his performance or growth, and shows discontents for other assignments (that might not look that shiny). What can I do?   Q2: Among all task assignments from my manager, I like those assignments that can help my performance or growth. Can I share my preferences? If so, how?

recordings.title: How to manage expectations from colleagues
recordings.question: Q1: My colleague(s) would share his(her) negative opinions about our boss and other colleagues. What can I do? Q2: My colleague, who referred me to my current employer and also a sister in Christ, expects me to give her heads up for all company business I am involved. She is not my supervisor. What can I do?

recordings.title: Serving at Marketplace
recordings.question: Q1: What is serving at marketplace? Q2: What are the challenges of serving at marketplace? What are the tips? What to avoid?

recordings.title: Breakthrough
recordings.question: Q1. What breakthrough do I expect to see at workplace? Q2. What are the barriers for breakthrough at workplace? What are the tips?

recordings.title: Interpersonal Relationship and Communication at workplace
recordings.question: Q1. Do I have healthy interpersonal relationship at workplace? Q2. What are the principles/tips for interpersonal relationship and communication at workplace? What are the taboos that you should avoid?

recordings.title: Thanksgiving
recordings.question: Q1: What/Who am I most thankful for in my career journey? Q2: What am I most thankful for my boss/colleague/subordinate? How have I expressed my appreciation?

recordings.title: How to respond in the workplace?
recordings.question: Q1: How shall I respond when I feel hurt in the workplace? Q2: How shall I perceive and respond when I was impacted by other's sins at workplace? Q3: How shall I perceive and respond when I was impacted by other's sins at a Christian based workplace?

recordings.title: Find balance between work, family, and faith
recordings.question: Q1: How do marketplace professionals find a balance between work, family and the time to seek spiritual growth/spend time with God? Q2: What are the special challenges for career women to find such a balance? What can be done?

recordings.title: Live out love
recordings.question: Q1: Is it possible to live out Love at workplace? There is no right or wrong in family training, but in the company, we need to focus on positive results and conduct assessments. Although we can all use love and tolerance, it still feels a bit difficult to practice. We often favor one over the other and cannot achieve a balance. Do the teachers and speakers have any good testimonies or experiences to share?Q2: Why do we want to live out love at workplace?

recordings.title: Work, Faith, and Life
recordings.question: Q1: I feel like I was living a double life: I live one life in my church and services during the weekend, and another life at my work Monday through Friday. What should I do? Q2:  I had a really comfortable work/life balance before my promotion. Now I felt a lot of stress at my work and started to wonder if I should have sought promotion in the first place. What did I miss? What can I do?

recordings.title: How to handle changes in the workplace
recordings.question: Q1: There is constant reorg in my company, what should I do? Q2: My company is starting to layoff, what should I do? Q3: My boss is leaving, and there are expected changes in the organization and my work, what should I do?

recordings.title: Relationships and conflicts in the workplace
recordings.question: Q1: What should I do when facing challenges in interpersonal relationships at work? Q2: My values at work are different from those of my colleagues and leaders, and I cannot fit into any team. What should I do?

recordings.title: How to handle failures in the workplace
Denying oneself
recordings.question: Is 'self-denial' applicable in the workplace? How to apply it?

recordings.title: Talents and expertise
recordings.question: Q1. What is the difference between talent and expertise? What is my talent? What is my expertise? Q2. How can I use/develop my talent/expertise in my family/workplace/service?

recordings.title: My boss doesn’t help; a good manager
recordings.question: Q1: What should I do if I have a problem and my supervisor is unwilling to help me solve it? Q2: What qualities does a good manager need to have, and how can I cultivate these qualities at work?

recordings.title: Communicating with people of strong personality
recordings.question: Q1. What are the characteristics of a strong person? Q2. How should I communicate with a strong colleague or boss?

recordings.title: Good qualities
recordings.question: Q1. What good qualities do influential people have in the workplace? Q2. How can I cultivate these good qualities in my life?

recordings.title: Increase influence
recordings.question: Q1. How can I improve my influence in my workplace? Q2. How can I make my faith have an impact in the workplace?

recordings.title: Which role suits me the best: Individual Contributor, Tech Lead, Manager?
Unfair bosses and proper communication
recordings.question: Q1: Character: Obedience: If you feel that your boss is unfair, how should you obey him? Q2: Communication: If your work results and performance do not satisfy your superiors, how should you face and respond?

recordings.title: Balancing faith, failure, and new beginnings
recordings.question: Q1: I agree that faith should be lived in the workplace, but the fact is that I am so overwhelmed by work that I have no ability to consider faith issues. How can I break through? Q2: The real estate design industry is becoming increasingly sluggish. I am almost 40 years old and still a front-line worker. I have no direction for the future and I don’t know where to go if I change industries. Now I am just muddling through. What should I do? Q3: As an ordinary employee, sometimes I fail to achieve the goals that my superiors ask me to do. I feel like a failure, but I am powerless. What should I do?

recordings.title: Colleagues, Boss, and Boundary
recordings.question: Q1: Should I help my coworkers on personal matters that are not work related? What are the boundaries? Q2: Should I help my boss on personal matters that are not work related? What are the boundaries? Q3: I have been helping my boss on personal matters (not work related) for a while, but I don’t want to do it anymore. What should I do?

recordings.title: Opportunities, challenges, and boundaries in workplace with Christians
recordings.question: We are colleagues and brother/sisters in Christ. As a colleague at the same level, am I suitable to listen to my colleagues' doubts and tensions at work and help them? How can I grasp this relationship of being both a brother/sister in Christ and a colleague at work? What is the boundary?

recordings.title: Complaint
recordings.question: Q1. Why do we complain about our work? Q2. Is there anything we can do?

recordings.title: To do or not to do
recordings.question: Q1. Should I accept the opportunity to tutor? Q2. Opportunities and boundaries

recordings.title: Asking questions
recordings.question: Q1. Does your boss ask difficult questions? What are those questions? How can you best answer them? Q2. What are the important questions to ask (my boss/coworkers/myself?) at work?

recordings.title: All about opportunities
recordings.question: We all need opportunities, and many people are looking for opportunities: 1. What is an opportunity? 2. How to find an opportunity? 3. What good opportunities are there for me?

recordings.title: How to prepare for your next job?
recordings.question: Q1. What is your next job? Q2. How do you prepare for your next job?

recordings.title: How to handle my high expectations and be a peacemaker at work?
recordings.question: Q1. I have a strong sense of responsibility and high expectations for my work. Therefore, I am willing to stay up late to ensure the quality of my work. Is this a problem? Is there anything else I should consider or do? Q2. How can I be a good peacemaker among my colleagues (in the workplace)?

recordings.title: Stress at work
recordings.question: What’s the main source of stress at work? How can I deal with it?

recordings.title: How my faith can positively impact my work?
How to bless a difficult boss
recordings.question: Q1. How to bless an unlovable boss? Last time I shared that bitterness is a factor that hinders blessing bosses, and the torrent of time is in God's hands. If a Christian boss reveals his own pride, has big mood swings, is often angry, has a strong personality, is prone to criticizing and judging others, and often feels disrespected, judged, and misunderstood in the process of getting along with him, how can I not be bitter and bless my boss better? Can you share more details on how to overcome your bitterness and these negative feelings and continue to love an unlovable person? Q2. How to be a (easily) lovable boss? Q3. Should the debts owed from normal operations be recovered? How to recover them in accordance with God's will? The desire to collect debts is very urgent. Doesn't it glorify God?
recordings.audioUrl: /audio/CCE20230417_祝福不容易愛的老板_應收賬款.mp3

recordings.title: Blessing your boss VS. Following your boss
recordings.question: Q1. Please explain the 'want to be ahead of the boss, but work behind the boss' mentioned on 3/27. Can you give an actual example? Q2. Same as above, if you find a problem in a certain business, can you raise it to the boss? Or make directional suggestions? Q3. In the workplace, how to set the sales price and profit ratio is in God's will? Q4. Is there any difference between 'blessing the boss' and 'obeying the boss' in the workplace? Does this view apply to the authority of the church?
recordings.audioUrl: /audio/CCE20230410_銷售價格_祝福老闆和順服老闆的不同.mp3

recordings.title: My boss doesn't value or listen to me, what should I do?
recordings.question: My boss doesn't value my opinions. 1. He never asks for my opinions before making decisions. What should I do? 2. He asks for my opinions but still insists on his own way of doing things. What should I do?

recordings.title: What do I want, what do I need, and how do I get what I need from my boss?
Stress and Happiness at work
recordings.question: Q1. My work makes me very stressed, what should I do? Q2. What is the secret to being happy at work?

recordings.title: Interacting with Christians at work
recordings.question: Q1. All my colleagues are Christians. They come from different churches and some from the same church. How do I deal with the sinfulness of other Christian colleagues at work and the conflicts and tensions between them? (For example, pride, competition, laziness, small groups, flattering the powerful and bullying the weak, inconsistency between what I say and what I do, inconsistent interpretation of the truth, etc.)

recordings.title: How to prepare myself for the generative-AI world to come?
recordings.audioUrl: /audio/CCE20230306_在“生成式人工智能”時代預備自己_r1.mp3

recordings.title: Do I shine in the workplace?
recordings.question: Q1. Am I shining in the workplace? How do I shine? Why can I shine? Q2. What (attitude, cognition, mentality, habit, or other) may limit God's blessing on me? Or the blessing that could have flown through me to others?

recordings.title: I have no passion for my work right now, what should I do?
recordings.question: Q1. I have no passion for my current job, what should I do? Q2. My boss doesn’t like me, what should I do? Q3. I am afraid to talk to my boss and always try to keep a distance from him. Is this right? What should I do? 4. If I have no passion for my job or my boss doesn’t like me, can I still wish my boss well?
